intro: Polygala melilotoides, commonly known as the sweet everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slightly hairy texture. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
